title: Personal Complaint #1: I feel lonely even though everyone is around me.
contentSnippet: Lately, there have been many unfortunate things happening, and I feel frustrated. As a result, I have been venting my complaints to others, and I'm worried that I might be disliked if this continues. Maybe I should write down my grievances. I'll probably write some really terrible things, but it would be nice if someone could empathize with me. Being alone is scary. Content warning: This text may hurt someone's feelings. Please read it with that understanding. Also, please don't share it with my parents. If you do, there won't be any consequences... but I'll cry. That's all. Let's continue reading.

title: I, a third grader, didn't want to go to school anymore.
contentSnippet: If you forget something, the teacher in charge will make you do a "punishment game". If you are bad at playing the recorder, the music teacher will yell at you loudly during detention. Now, it wouldn't be a big deal, but back when I was in elementary school, it was really scary for me. Every time I made a weird mistake, the whole class would go silent and everyone would look at me with disdain. If someone tried to support me, they would also be looked at with disdain. From the first and second grade of elementary school where we were all friends, to the day in third grade where it became about who was the smartest, I started to not want to go to school anymore. But today, I still have to go to school. I arrive at the nearest station to the school, filled with anxiety that I might get scolded again. The three-minute walk of about 200 meters feels heavy as I continue on.

title: [ATO2] List of Most Important Cities in the Early Stages (Updating)

I have categorized them into six regions: Asia, Middle East, Europe, North and South America, Africa, and Australia. I will also provide information on the city's economic size (total of business and tourism levels). I will list them in order of priority (including places with less competition and easier to compete in), but please note that there may be exceptions. Continue reading Asia.

title: If I had a lot of money, what would I do?
contentSnippet: If I had money, I thought I could do all sorts of things. But that was just a fantasy. When I actually bought services or products with money, I would be really happy at first, but after about three days, I would lose interest. Is having a lot of money really happiness? Read more.
